problem.subject: old ticket 16089 - Library media in study rooms

problem-body.description:
Hello Support,I was just forwarded the following e-mail:_____________________________________From: Bitz, Scott K. Sent: Wednesday, September 17, 2014 11:02 AM To: Library Subject: AV Ticket
On 9/15 Sean Kelly, one of the Library Circulation desk workers put in a ticket about the wireless TV connectivity not working in L207 and I believe they were stolen. After checking in the room, I found that there was nothing connected to HDMI 1 where the devices to connect wirelessly should be connected on the TVs. Also, there are two loose Ethernet cables hanging from the switch in the back panel and nothing else in there besides the VGA cables and HDMI cables. Also the back panel was open when I got in there and none of the screws on it. SO that is why I believe they were stolen.
Scott Bitz AV Tech ____________________________________We'll place an "out of order" sign in the room. In the meantime, can Tony Cottrill or Peter Pfister contact me about this problem? I'm wondering what we need to do to have the problem fixed, and how much it will cost, and I'm wondering what we need to do to with respect to security in order to try to prevent this problem in the future. Thanks,Gary Shimek Director of the Library x7181 Time Available: Anytime
problem-body.description-html: Hello Support,I was just forwarded the following e-mail:_____________________________________From: Bitz, Scott K. Sent: Wednesday, September 17, 2014 11:02 AM To: Library Subject: AV Ticket On 9/15 Sean Kelly, one of the Library Circulation desk workers put in a ticket about the wireless TV connectivity not working in L207 and I believe they were stolen. After checking in the room, I found that there was nothing connected to HDMI 1 where the devices to connect wirelessly should be connected on the TVs. Also, there are two loose Ethernet cables hanging from the switch in the back panel and nothing else in there besides the VGA cables and HDMI cables. Also the back panel was open when I got in there and none of the screws on it. SO that is why I believe they were stolen. Scott Bitz AV Tech ____________________________________We'll place an "out of order" sign in the room. In the meantime, can Tony Cottrill or Peter Pfister contact me about this problem? I'm wondering what we need to do to have the problem fixed, and how much it will cost, and I'm wondering what we need to do to with respect to security in order to try to prevent this problem in the future. Thanks,Gary Shimek Director of the Library x7181 Time Available: Anytime

note.body: Additional information from old ticket 21566 8/14/15: Using restricted account funds, EECS requests to purchase a 65" 1080p LED backlit display for use in the Johnson Controls Software Development Laboratory. We found a model recommended by CNET that has a good price less than $1000 including shipping from Dell or Newegg. Vizio Model E65-C3 http://www.vizio.com/e65c3.html I could not find a similar spec model at CDW. With your permission, we could order it using the EECS credit card. Please let me know. Thanks. Steve W 277-7420

problem-body.description:
Martin Handley wants to verify that a projector system has been ordered for S-343, the lab under construction. He wants to make sure that AV can have it installed before 9/7/2015.
Speakers have been installed. We've discussed projector placement, and the need for a shelf to place the Crestron, the document camera, and a faculty computer. Marty is going to build a small add-on shelf and have an instructor table set near the hole in the wall where the equipment will be wired.
problem-body.description-html:
Martin Handley wants to verify that a projector system has been ordered for S-343, the lab under construction. He wants to make sure that AV can have it installed before 9/7/2015.

Speakers have been installed. We've discussed projector placement, and the need for a shelf to place the Crestron, the document camera, and a faculty computer. Marty is going to build a small add-on shelf and have an instructor table set near the hole in the wall where the equipment will be wired.

note.body: projectors and equipment were installed on 9/3/15. Requested Russ Meier and Steve Williams to test to confirm. Steve Williams confirmed that all was working properly.
note.body-html: projectors and equipment were installed on 9/3/15. Requested Russ Meier and Steve Williams to test to confirm. Steve Williams confirmed that all was working properly.

problem.subject: Early Account Disabling before Sept. 11th deadline

problem-body.description: To the best of my knowledge, the system is singling out random accounts that so far have not taken any summer classes and have not yet registered for fall classes. The system is disabling their accounts even though they have a deadline of September 11th to still use their account and back up their files. A lot of these students are unable to transfer important emails and documents.

A lot of these students are unable to transfer important emails and documents.

problem-body.description:
Hello,
I am having difficulty getting my pay stub on my.msoe.edu.
I go to the Employees tab, I select Direct Deposit Stub and select the date. I wait, and it appears that the PDF gets created. I click on the PDF link and then instead of opening the file, it opens a new window within my.msoe.edu. I am unable to get the PDF to open.
Thanks for your help!
===================================== Charlene A. Yauch, Ph.D., P.E. Professor and IE Program Director Milwaukee School of Engineering S-112H (414) 277-7258 yauch@msoe.edu =====================================
problem-body.description-html:
Hello,
 
I am having difficulty getting my pay stub on my.msoe.edu.
 
I go to the Employees tab, I select Direct Deposit Stub and select the date.  I wait, and it appears that the PDF gets created.  I click on the PDF link and then instead of opening the file, it opens a new window within my.msoe.edu.  I am unable to get the PDF to open.
 
Thanks for your help!
 
=====================================
Charlene A. Yauch, Ph.D., P.E.
Professor and IE Program Director
Milwaukee School of Engineering
S-112H
(414) 277-7258
yauch@msoe.edu
=====================================

problem.subject: Helpdesk Technicians Unable to View Tickets Elevated Above Tier One

problem-body.description:
Fairly frequent occurrence where a requester will call the Helpdesk, ask for an update on a ticket. Ticket happens to be in a queue that is above tier one. Freshservice blocks us from viewing the ticket at all. This makes IT look disorganized, forces us to call the busy tier 2+ IT staff to simply read the status of the ticket. If this occurs outside normal business hours there is often no one else to contact, so we are forced to make another ticket simply asking for an update on the main ticket. There must be a better way to handle elevated tickets. In ITDirect we were at least able to see the status of elevated tickets.
This seems to stem from the beginning of our adoption of Freshservice when tier one staff was told to constantly check up on all open tickets. I believe that this will no longer be an issue, as tier one has been told not to do this.
This issue has been brought up during meetings but no official response is given.
problem-body.description-html:
Fairly frequent occurrence where a requester will call the Helpdesk, ask for an update on a ticket. Ticket happens to be in a queue that is above tier one. Freshservice blocks us from viewing the ticket at all. This makes IT look disorganized, forces us to call the busy tier 2+ IT staff to simply read the status of the ticket. If this occurs outside normal business hours there is often no one else to contact, so we are forced to make another ticket simply asking for an update on the main ticket. There must be a better way to handle elevated tickets. In ITDirect we were at least able to see the status of elevated tickets.

This seems to stem from the beginning of our adoption of Freshservice when tier one staff was told to constantly check up on all open tickets. I believe that this will no longer be an issue, as tier one has been told not to do this. 

This issue has been brought up during meetings but no official response is given.

problem-body.description:
After logging in to the IT Helpdesk and randomly digging through tickets, I have come across several that indicated they had been forwarded to the MSOE Community for a response.
I am the MSOE Community, and none of these have been showing up in the Community email. Can someone check to ensure the email address for Community is "community@msoe.edu"?
Also, when a ticket is being assigned, the only agent listed in the drop-down under MSOE Community is Jordan Longato. He's a student who doesn't work in this department any more, so I'd like to have this changed to the staff person responsible for managing web help requests - that's me. I'm already in the agent list. Jordan shouldn't appear on the list as an option.
Also see ticket #INC-8167.
Thanks--
Kent Peterson peterson@msoe.edu (414) 277-7176
problem-body.description-html:
After logging in to the IT Helpdesk and randomly digging through tickets, I have come across several that indicated they had been forwarded to the MSOE Community for a response.

 I am the MSOE Community, and none of these have been showing up in the Community email. Can someone check to ensure the email address for Community is "community@msoe.edu"?

Also, when a ticket is being assigned, the only agent listed in the drop-down under MSOE Community is Jordan Longato. He's a student who doesn't work in this department any more, so I'd like to have this changed to the staff person responsible for managing web help requests - that's me. I'm already in the agent list. Jordan shouldn't appear on the list as an option.

Also see ticket  #INC-8167.

Thanks--

Kent Peterson
peterson@msoe.edu
(414) 277-7176

problem-impact.description: Graduate students whose passwords have expired

problem.subject: Grohmann Towers wireless issues after circuit changeover

problem-symptom.description: the internet takes 5 minutes for a google page to load from my room (room number 411) whereas when I pass the electrical room area towards the main hall on the fourth floor, it works perfectly fine and loads in seconds like normal. I don’t know why but I feel like there is data loss after that point in the hallway where the rooms are and it doesn’t seem to load in my room but there wasn’t this issue until after 4am in the morning when I slept. I noticed this issue only this morning. So far, I've seen only a few issues, the first being that I can no longer connect to battle.net, a game service by Blizzard, from the Tower apartments, however I can from other places. I was also prompted by another game that said that the NAT settings are set to strict, which I never got before. Both of these only started today.
problem-symptom.description-html:
the internet takes 5 minutes for a google page to load from my room (room number 411) whereas when I pass the electrical room area towards the main hall on the fourth floor, it works perfectly fine and loads in seconds like normal. I don’t know why but I feel like there is data loss after that point in the hallway where the rooms are and it doesn’t seem to load in my room but there wasn’t this issue until after 4am in the morning when I slept. I noticed this issue only this morning.

So far, I've seen only a few issues, the first being that I can no longer connect to battle.net, a game service by Blizzard, from the Tower apartments, however I can from other places. I was also prompted by another game that said that the NAT settings are set to strict, which I never got before. Both of these only started today.

problem-body.description: Several reports of very slow speed over the Tower wireless. The signal strength is there, 2 bars at least, but the download speed is very poor. In the Hallways leading up to apt is 80Kbps and there is nothing once in the apartments.
problem-body.description-html: Several reports of very slow speed over the Tower wireless.  The signal strength is there, 2 bars at least, but the download speed is very poor.  In the Hallways leading up to apt is 80Kbps and there is nothing once in the apartments.

Dr. Medhat Khalil, Ph.D.
Director of Professional Education & Research Development
Certified Fluid Power Hydraulic Specialist
Accredited Fluid Power Instructor
Applied Technology Center
Milwaukee School of Engineering
Tel:  414-277-7269 Cell: 414-940-2232
Fax: 414-277-7470   khalil@msoe.edu
Add: 1025 N. Broadway, Milwaukee, WI, 53202-3109, USA
 
From: helpdesk [mailto:helpdesk@msoe.edu]
Sent: Wednesday, February 15, 2017 1:34 PM
To: Khalil, Dr. Medhat <khalil@msoe.edu>
Subject: Problem Closed - [#PRB-37] User unable to put in Budget for his department

The problem you requested (#PRB-37) has been closed.

In case you would like to know anything more about this problem, please click on the link below..

Regards,

problem-body.description-html: The touch panel is shutoff. the projector doesn't receive any input/signal.

problem.subject: Ongoing Network Issues - Wired and Wireless

problem-impact.description: devices became saturated with ARP requests causing them to fail, and the topology to change.
problem-impact.description-html: devices became saturated with ARP requests causing them to fail, and the topology to change.

problem-cause.description: Network ARP flooding due to introduction of a unmanaged switch or device. We have limited the reach of flooding on non-edge switches and reduced the overall ability to cause loops and floods on edge devices.
problem-cause.description-html: Network ARP flooding due to introduction of a unmanaged switch or device. We have limited the reach of flooding on non-edge switches and reduced the overall ability to cause loops and floods on edge devices.

problem-body.description: Campus-wide issues with the network causing random switch outages, slow network speeds, saturated ports, and dropped wireless access points. The network team continues to address these issue. Please associate wireless and wired complaints and slowness issues to this ticket.
problem-body.description-html: Campus-wide issues with the network causing random switch outages, slow network speeds, saturated ports, and dropped wireless access points. The network team continues to address these issue. Please associate wireless and wired complaints and slowness issues to this ticket.

problem.subject: Student having issues with Kaspersky and WAMP server

problem-body.description: Wamp not connecting and other issues
problem-body.description-html: Wamp not connecting and other issues

problem.subject: Grohman Tower internet is recently slow

problem-body.description: Many residents of the Grohman Towers have complained about very slow performance.
problem-body.description-html: Many residents of the Grohman Towers have complained about very slow performance.

problem.subject: Issue Connecting Wireless Sonos Play 1 Speaker to wifi in Office

problem-body.description:
I am trying to connect my wireless, Sonos Play:1 wireless speaker to the MSOE_guest wifi network in my office. I have failed miserably. After contacting Sonos for help, they believe there may be something in the firewall or an issue obtaining the IP address that is preventing the connection. They provided two resources for IT departments to help:
https://sonos.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/2871/~/wireless-connection-error https://sonos.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/692
https://sonos.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/2129
I have set up two of these same speakers to my home's wireless network without issue, and hope that you can help me set one up in my office as well.
problem-body.description-html:
I am trying to connect my wireless, Sonos Play:1 wireless speaker to the MSOE_guest wifi network in my office. I have failed miserably. After contacting Sonos for help, they believe there may be something in the firewall or an issue obtaining the IP address that is preventing the connection. They provided two resources for IT departments to help: 

https://sonos.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/2871/~/wireless-connection-error

https://sonos.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/692

https://sonos.custhelp.com/app/answers/detail/a_id/2129

I have set up two of these same speakers to my home's wireless network without issue, and hope that you can help me set one up in my office as well.

problem.subject: Windows not activated after grad image

problem-body.description:
Creating a problem for these tickets in order to track how many come in like this. Will probably be an issue on all 840G3's.
When grad imaged, the 840G3's do not successfully license Windows 10.
problem-body.description-html:
Creating a problem for these tickets in order to track how many come in like this.  Will probably be an issue on all 840G3's.

When grad imaged, the 840G3's do not successfully license Windows 10.

problem-body.description-html: GET Portal is giving a general error. Users are unable to add funds to their managed accounts. There is a ticket open with CBORD

problem-body.description:
Tickets related to this issue should contain:
Who the person is Time the issue occurred Building Room number Wired or WiFi ipconfig /all Wall port number (optional)
problem-body.description-html:
Tickets related to this issue should contain:
Who the person is
Time the issue occurred
Building
Room number
Wired or WiFi

ipconfig /all 

Wall port number (optional)
